Information
Installation

Setup your .htaccess file by navigating to the root of the extracted zip files. Open the htaccess file and between the forward slashes (/) put your folder or if you have no folder and you extracted to the root of your development server (e.g. XAMPP) just put a forward slash.

For example:

// If not using a folder
RewriteBase /
// If using a folder
RewriteBase /YOUR_FOLDER/
Htaccess Template
RewriteEngine On
Options -Indexes
RewriteBase /YOUR_FOLDER/
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-l
# Make sure to include the rewrite rule below in order for it to run properly:
RewriteRule ^(.+) index.php?url=$1 [QSA,L]

Then, in your routes.php file set your default controller:

NOTE: I'm using a Pages controller in this example, so depending on your situation you only need the first line including the name of your controller; it attempts to load the index method by default but you can include that as well like the example below. The second line is using Wildcards which is discussed in the documentation.

// application/config/routes.php
$route['default_controller']   = 'Pages/index';
$route['(:any)']               = 'Pages/index/$1';

Next, set your base_url in your config.php file to:

$config['base_url']  = 'http://localhost/YOUR_CONTROLLER/';

Finally, open up your browser, make sure your server software is running, and navigate to: http://​localhost​/YOUR_CONTROLLER​/ and don't forget to create a view file in your view folder and call it using $this->load->view() in your newly created controller, otherwise, you'll be left with a blank screen or error message.
